question: A case of chicken pox should he isolated for a period of:
exp: Ans: A (6 days) Ref: Park 22nd edition pg 112. Explanation: Disease. Isolation. Measles. From onset of catarrhal stage through 3rd day of rash. Chicken pox. Until all lesions enisled about 6 days of rashH zoster6 days after onset of rash. Influenza3 days after onset. Polio2 weeks for adult, 6 weeks pediatrics. Hepatitis3 weeks. Pertussis4 weeks or until paroxysms ceases. Mumps. Until swelling subsides. TBUntil 3 weeks of effective chemotherapy. Chicken pox and herpes zoster have same period of isolation i. e. till 6 days of rash. Pertussis and mumps till the major symptom subsides i. e. paroxysmal cough in pertussis and swelling in mumps.
